Components include the betting board, a deck of standard playing cards, a die, red poker chips, a wooden table rake, and the book "Rules of Carlette".

21726.name: Coast to Coast
21726.description:
From the box: "An Educational Action Game for 2 to 4 players. Learn to Know America While Traveling!"

Game board features a map of the U.S. with a built-in spinner. Players travel a circular track around around the map visiting landmarks as they go. A fun way to learn geography!

Players start on NYC, and move the number of spaces indicated by the spinner. Land on a red space, lose a turn. Land on a blue space, go again. First to return to NYC wins.

21728.name: The Dale Carnegie Game
21728.description: Based on the best-selling book "How To Win Friends and Influence People", this game teaches the principals of the book and helps players develop more dynamic interpersonal skills.

21729.description:
From the publisher: "The game is about a group of snakes wandering in the woods trying to eat the apples that fall down from the trees (and avoiding eating the poisonous mushrooms). The snakes' frenzy bring them to run between the trees and players must me able to "pilot" them to the apples, avoiding mushrooms, trees and the other snakes. The game is card driven (the cards are describe the possible movements)."

SnakeLake is a cross between the old computer game Snake and the board game Robo Rally, but is much simpler and faster than RR. You have a simple board with a grid and place some apple trees around, then each player chooses a starting point.

Each player uses cards to program their next three moves in secret on their own chart, with the 2nd and 3rd move sliding down each turn when the 1st card is used and a new card going in the 3rd slot. The cards simply show forward, left, right (twice each) and one stop card. They also tell you to draw an Event card, which add some randomness.

If your snake runs into a tree, or off the board when incomplete, or into another snake's body, you start over again somewhere else, reprogramming your next three snake moves. If you hit another snake's head, they go off and you score a point for each segment of their body. If you get your whole snake on the board and then get your head off the board, you score points for the length of your snake.

But the big points come from eating apples which fall from the apple trees. These have 8-12 points on them, and your snake runs over them to eat them and reveal the points scored. Likewise, there are some mushrooms which deduct points if eaten. The apples and mushrooms are placed when an Event card indicates. The other events include removing an apple, sending an opponent's snake to sleep (miss a turn), and make your snake's body longer or shorter.

Snake Lake is a light, fast, fun game and will suit children more than adult's. The best strategy seems to be eat an apple then get knocked off the board to start somewhere else, near more apples. Getting your whole snake on and off is hard work, and scores few points in comparison.

The components are nicely made, good shiny cards that should wear well. The rules need a little proof-reading but were clear enough. Snake Lake might be better for 3 or 4 players than 6 though, it got very crowded very quickly, even on the large side of the board.
21729.name: Snake Lake

21730.name: Delta
21730.description:
Delta, created by Swiss chess problem composer Erich Brunner, comes with two small boards (one is 5x5 rectangles, the other is 6x6 squares), nine triangular pieces in two colors, and one extra piece in a third color.

In Delta, after entering their initial pieces by a free placement, players alternate moving pieces of their own color on the 5x5 board at least two spaces (vertically, horizontally or diagonally), then placing a new piece on the space last passed over by the moving piece. The goal is to create a line of four pieces in your own color or to prevent the other player from being able to move. The winner scores one point for each empty space for making a line or one point for stalemating the opponent. Individual rounds are brief, and several rounds are usually played in a series with the overall winner being the first to reach a pre-determined number of points (such as 100).

Neo-Delta is similar, except it is played on the 6x6 board, and either / both players may use the third color piece (placed by the first player on the first or second move) to form their line of four. Draws are possible.

21731.name: Card Football
21731.description:
This is a game that uses a regular deck of cards to simulate offensive play-calling in (American) football. Combinations of colors, suits and pips determine the amount of yardage gained, or lost, when they are drawn from the deck. (For instance, clubs often indicate a botched offensive play.)

Players must choose whether to call a running, passing or kicking play before drawing the cards and this choice effects how the cards are interpreted.

Card Football was published in the book Card Games Around the World.

21732.name: World Traveler
21732.description: From the box- World Traveler is an educational board game which expands the players' knowledge of the world. The object of the game is for players to complete their world travels while encountering obstacles and adventures along the way. Two to six players can play the game. The player to finish first is the winner, but other players can continue until they finish their world travels.

21733.name: Starluk
21733.description:
From the box: "The Fortune Telling Game"

Players keep score telling each others' fortunes. Rules describe group play as well as more traditional tarot use.

The game was shipped in a book-shaped box (one side was shaped like a curved book spine and the others were printed with a design to make them look like book pages) and included a poker-sized tarot deck, a pad of score sheets, and a rules sheet.

21734.name: Krumble
21734.description:
From the publisher:

The game is about the adventures of a group of explorer/archaeologists inside an Aztec Pyramid. Inside there was the big treasure they were looking for but also the traps that this old temple hides. The stones are moving and the Pyramid starts to crumble. Here starts the game: players must desperately try to reach the exit before everything collapses over them!

21737.name: A Corner Of Hell
boardgamepublisher: HLBS Publishing (The Honourable Lead Boiler Suit Company)
21737.description:
"A Corner of Hell" is a set of rules designed for fast, enjoyable skirmish level games set in the second World War.
The rules include all kinds of weapons & vehicles, from regular troops to elite.

21738.name: The Prep Game
21738.description:
Are you wearing an alligator shirt? A Polo tie? What are you driving? A "woody" station wagon? Did you have a Teddy Bear as a toddler? What clubs do you belong to? THE Country Club?

In The Prep Game, players move their calling cards, with names like Muffy, Sissy, or Corky, around a board, collecting scoring cards and visiting places like "Mummy's and Daddy's," the "Chariot Races," "Miss Comer's Dance Classes," and the "Debut at the Plaza." The players also collect doubling or tripling cards as well while traveling around the board. The first player to 25,000 points wins.

21739.name: Pony Ride
21739.description:
From the box:
Do you like ponies? Experience the country life by playing PONY RIDE. Pony Ride is an educational and fun game where children can learn about a pony barn and a real farm!

In the PONY RIDE game you will... Spin the spinner and follow the hoof prints along the trail through the countryside!

BE THE FIRST PONY HOME TO THE BARN!

Cross a bridge...Jump a jump...Take a shortcut through the apple orchard! Will your pony stop along the trail to eat apples? Will your pony stop to eat grass? OR WILL YOUR PONY BE THE FIRST PONY TO GET HOME TO THE BARN AND WIN THE GAME? This game includes:

The barn box for the ponies The game board with pop-ups The story book about the ponies and farm The rules A spinner And the four pony play pieces: Allie, Pal, Knight and Honey

In the pony ride game, the players ride through the countryside on four friendly ponies:

Honey Pony - is the yellow pony. She is very sweet and loves to be petted. She is gentle and soft. Knight - is the red pony. He is young, playful, and curious Pal - is the black pony. He is smart, strong, and likes to be first. Allie - is the white pony. She loves to run and run and run. She can dance and drink tea!

Remember - you can put your pony's head out of the barn window if you are the first to the barn. The pony can watch. Or put your pony in the green field next to the barn to eat grass!

Players: 1-4 Ages 3 and up Who Wins: The first pony to reach the barn wins. This player must spin a yellow hoof print to enter the barn and win. Note: Reading is not required Instructions tell you how to play different games

21740.name: The Incredible Shrinky Dinks Game
21740.description:
From the creator:
This fun and easy to play game allows you to circle the game board and collect Shrinky Dinks from the six different areas of Shrinky Dinks Land. You will to go into the Shrinky Dinks Maker and shrink to get into Shrinky Dinks Land, collect your five game pieces and then head for the Shrinky Dinks Maker to get big again. When you’re big, it’s time to race for the finish.

21741.name: Underdog to the Rescue
21741.description:
A children's game for 2 to 4 players Ages 6-10. Players race to see who is the first person to rescue Sweet Polly. Spin the spinner, move the number of spaces, look at the hidden tokens.

Simple game for kids.

Underdog rocks.

21742.name: Transformers Card Game
21742.description:
From the box:

They come from the planet Cybertron, and now they are on earth to continue their eternal conflict. They are the transformers and they are out of this world.

Joint the transformers in this exciting fun-to-play card game, in which heroic autobots and evil decepticons are joined by the dinobots and insecticons.

The winner is the player who collects the most sets of Transformers.

Based in the Transformers Universe.

21743.description:
A 2 player game. Players take turns placing tiles into the grid trying to form squares. Completed squares are marked, and the player gets another turn. When the board is filled, the person with the most squares wins.

This game is the same as the paper and pencil game "Dots and Boxes" played on a 7x7 box grid.

The title of the German edition is just "Square". The German word for the traditional paper and pencil game is "Käsekästchen".
21743.name: Square It

21744.name: Shaman King Collectible Figure Game
21744.description:
The starter set for the Shaman King Collectible Figure Game, based on Shonen Jump's 'Shaman King ' television and manga series. The set contains everything needed for two players to begin playing immediately: 8 pre-painted figures, 1 double-sided game map, 6 Shaman King dice and 1 rule booklet.

The gameplay is derived from Sabertooth's Lord of the Rings Tradeable Miniatures Game, with new additions and powers to reflect the summoning magic of battles in the Shaman King setting.

21745.name: Le Wine Game
21745.description:
Le Wine Game is a wine tasting party game for 1 to 4 couples.

The host selects four wines, places them on numbered locations on the "game board," and lets each person sample the four wines. A notepad/scoresheet is provided for each couple to take notes on the wines. Then the wines are removed, and the host again distributes samples of each wine to the guests. The guests now attempt to identify the wines using their notes. The first taster or team to call out the correct identification is declared "Wine Judge of the Evening."

The game is designed to help players learn about wine. Wine tasters are encouraged to file away their notes in a note box (provided) so that they may have "a permanent record of all your wine tasting impressions."

21746.name: Pionjär
21746.description:
From the rules:

'They came as poor immigrants - the ticket to cross the Atlantic had consumed most of the money earned back in Sweden - but they were rich on optimism, energy and and enterprising attitude.'

Farm, hunt, gamble in the saloon and mine gold from 1858 to 1862. The game starts with a race for the best property, which is then used to harvest grain and timber. Special routes on the board allows for fish, buffalo and gold income. You can also frequent a saloon, drug store and be sent to prison.

21747.name: Big League Manager Baseball Game
21747.description:
Big League Manager Baseball contained two large charts, which were accessed by using a 100-number spinner. Each player (pitcher and batter) has their own card. One fairly unique aspect of the game was that the pitchers had a separate rating for giving up hits with men on base as they did for bases empty.
All the standard options are available. The instructions are copyright 1958 and the charts 1963 in a set representing the 1968 season.

21748.name: The Shadow Game
21748.description:
Be the player to win the battle against Shiwan Khan. To go into battle, you must have a Margo Lane card, a Reinhardt Lane card, and the Phurba in your possession.
Players take turns moving The Shadow pawn and following the instructions on the space.
Collecting cards is very important throughout the game. When you collect a card, keep it secret it your hand. Some cards are needed for the final battle, some you play on your turn or another player's turn. No player may have more than four cards at a time.
If you have the necessary cards and the Phurba and it is your turn, you can battle Shiwan Khan by rolling the Phurba dice five times. If you get doubles in that time, you win. Otherwise, you surrender the Phurba and continue.

21749.name: Scene It? Squabble
21749.description:
From the publisher:

Gals are you ready for that oxymoron known as Men's Culture? Guys are you man enough to handle a "Chick Flick?" Find out when you play Scene It? Squabble, the high-spirited game that decides which sex is truly the master of their own domain. "Do you know what Lip Venom is?" "What's the average PSI for most tires?" Couples will test their mental muscles through real movie and TV clips, visual puzzlers and trivia questions guaranteed to redefine your sense of sexual stereotypes. Scene It? Squabble - an equal opportunity entertainer.

21750.name: Tummy Ache Junk Food Game
21750.description:
The object of the game is to feed "Tommy Tummy Ache" his favorite Junk food without giving him a "Tummy Ache"
The players take turns (according to a spinner, not alternating), placing food on the mouth of the cardboard Tommy Tummy Ache character. If the food is placed improperly, the food will all spill and the player must use one of their tummy ache pills to make him better. This continues until all but one player has used up both their tummy ache pills.

21752.description: You are trying to collect the card of a same color to make a matching set og items: engine, gift, ticket and invitation. It basically a matching game, where you are matching colors instead of pictures.
21752.name: Thomas and Friends Card Game: Station Celebration!

21753.name: Hälge Jaktfeber
21753.description: You take the role as "Hälge" the Moose and are supposed to move around in the forest (the board) collecting elk antler. To win you need to find 12 of them. But in the forest the hunters Edwin, Uffe and their dog Blixten (Flash) lurks making the life hard for Hälge.

boardgamehonor: 2006 Fairplay À la carte Winner
2006 Kinderspielexperten "8-to-13-year-olds" Nominee
2007 Golden Geek Best Card Game Nominee
21754.description:
From boardgamenews.com:

The Sheriff of Nottingham is in trouble! His time in power is nearing its end, and he hasn’t quite managed to get enough cash together to buy another year in office. So he sends his Deputies out to collect the overdue taxes and promises to promote the most successful Deputy to the rank of Chief Assistant. Is it any wonder, then, that the Deputies think nothing of occasionally picking their colleagues’ pockets?

Contents: 1 Scoreboard, 8 Playing Pieces, 110 Cards, 1 Rules Insert
21754.name: Nottingham

21755.name: Scrabble: Simpsons Edition
21755.description: The Simpsons edition of Scrabble features several rule changes from the regular game. Players can play special cards on their turn to help them or hinder their opponents. Certain words popularized by The Simpsons are permitted (notably KWYJIBO). Also, the bonus squares on the playing board are arranged in a different, irregular pattern.

21756.name: The Magic of Football
21756.description: Make the best team as coach, play the tournament and bring your team to the final.

21757.name: Cram!
21757.description:
From the Publisher:
'The phenomenal new board game where college life collides with pop culture. Cram! is the intensely competitive laughing, guessing, acting, drawing, singing, shouting game for your whole body. On the riotously fictional Cram State University campus, players form "Study groups" to move around the campus and engage in various high energy, pop culture related courses including Cramspeak, GroupTroups, TimeTrivial, Illustronomy, Lyriculous, and Slangshot. Watch out! Your extra-curricular goofing off might affect your grades! Ages 13 and up, absolutely no real education required!'

Players are formed into two teams (study groups). Each group circles the board (the campus) twice, stopping to be graded on challenges (classrooms). From the winning study group, the two players with the highest score (grade) go on to compete for Doctor of Culturology.

From the box:
'Cramspeak - use sounds, gestures, words, phrases and charades to get your StudyGroup to shout out the right answers.

GroupTroupes - Shout out answers based upon a performance by your entire StudyGroup.

Illustronomy - Your StudyGroup must guess the answers based upon your multiple drawings.

TimeTrivial - Your entire StudyGroup must guess the correct answer to a multiple choice trivia question.

Lyriculous - You sing the tune to a popular song and your StudyGroup has to name it.

SlangShot - Your StudyGroup must provide as many slang words for a common word or phrase as possible.'

This game was the winner of the "All Star Radio Networks" 2002 Party Game of the Year.

21758.name: Sproing
21758.description:
SPROING
The Action Game of Unbearable Fun!

AGES: 7 to Adult
OBJECT: Get rid of your cards in hand, but also avoid getting stuck with the discard pile cards when the SPROING tray goes "SPROING!"
EQUIPMENT: 1 Special SPROING pop-up discard tray
54 Numbered Cards consisting of: 32 Blue Cards and 22 Yellow Cards
1 Bag
6 Multi-Colored Plastic Chips

Each player in turn discards a card in the special SPROING tray before it pops up. Yellow action cards add excitement to the game by directing players to roll dice, find color chips in a bag or count out loud before discarding a card.

This curious game relies on a coiled plastic tray that may be pressed down to become held in place by a sucker. The sucker holds the tray down for about 1.5 minutes (according to the makers) before suddenly releasing the tray, allowing it to pop up and scatter all cards that happened to be on it.

Players try to play a card that is either a '1' or a number higher than the top card on the tray. The blue cards are numbered from 1 to 10, with lots more 1s than other numbers. The yellow cards are numbered from 1 to 9, but also have actions described on them that must be performed by the next player. The next player has to complete the actions before they are allowed to play their card. The actions could require players to count (for example, from "Sproing 1" to "Sproing 10"), roll a specific combination on two special dice (each die has 3 blank sides and 3 sides showing a coiled spring), or draw a chip of a specified color from an opaque bag.

Anyone unfortunate enough to have the tray pop up during their turn has to keep all scattered cards, which count as points against the player who owns them. The player with the lowest number of points wins.

21759.name: Carlo Derby
21759.description:
Carlo Derby is a depression era horse racing game. It comes in an orange and white tube with all the components rolled up in an oil cloth track. The game contains a layout cloth, race tickets, ticket punch, five horse and a mixer called the "carlo box". The carlo box contains 6 white marbles, 5 red, 4 blue, 3 green and 1 black.
As the marbles are dispensed, the horses advance. There are three raised felt circles below the track that receive marbles when you push the carlo box down. The track has a fast and a muddy (slow) lane for each horse. For example, the black horse fast track has only one space, which means he finishes the race the first time his marble comes up (1/19). The black horse muddy track has two spaces. You can bet on horses to win, place or show, and the payoff odds are shown on the track. For example, black pays 8.5 to 1 for a win on the fast track or 24 to one for a win on the slow track.
The best part of this game is the quality of the molded glass horses. The tickets are also very realistic looking.
The designer and publication date are unknown. However, the game is described as patent pending, and the company address is 268 First Street in San Francisco.

The "carlo box" could also be found (with the same marbles) in the game Lido

21760.name: Strike Price
21760.description:
Strike Price: The Options Trading Strategy Game.

From the rule book: "The object of the game is to become the wealthiest player. Players try to increase their wealth by buying and selling stock, puts and calls in response to various events, tips, and other players' activities".

There are three versions of the game - the Basic Game, the Advanced Game and the Advanced Game with Optional Rules. The Basic game includes put, call and stock purchasing. The Advanced Game adds borrowing, short selling, and the writing of option contracts. The Optional Rules are available for those players wishing to add even more realism at the expense of playability.

21761.name: Good Humor Game
21761.description: A children's game that teaches matching and counting using something they all love: the Good Humor Ice Cream Truck!! The truck moves around the path dispensing the many treats that the children have learned are there. The winner is the first player to collect four cards with the same flavor.

21762.name: Get in Gear
21762.description:
From the back of the box:

A Challenging Race to Avoid Pitfalls in the Road and Reach the Finish Line First!

Out of Gas! Flat Tire! Cows on the road!

Players "drive" their cars on the ever-changing road, trying to avoid oil slicks, broken glass, accidents, and more. You decide how far you will drive each turn by how many dice you choose to roll. Green lights mean GO so the more green lights you roll the farther you can travel. But if you roll a red light you can't go anywhere - - - -

As you make your journey you must watch the instruments on your dashboard, too. You may run out of gas, or your engine may overheat.

boardgamehonor: 2006 Tric Trac Nominee
2007 Golden Geek Best 2-Player Board Game Nominee
2007 International Gamers Awards - General Strategy; Two-players
2007 Nederlandse Spellenprijs Nominee
2008 As d'Or - Jeu de l'Année Nominee
2008 JoTa Best 2-Player Board Game Nominee
2008 JoTa Best 2-Player Board Game Winner
2011 Vuoden Peli Adult Game of the Year Nominee
21763.description:
In Mr. Jack, one of the two players represents Jack the Ripper, who will be one of the eight characters on the board. This player knows which character is Mr. Jack, and his goal is to flee from the district as soon as possible (or avoid being accused for eight turns). The other player represents an independent investigator (not represented on the board) who tries to guess the identity of Jack — but he can make only one accusation during the game!

During each turn, the players move the characters, using their special powers and placing them either in shadow or light. At the end of each turn, the witnesses declare whether Jack is visible — that is, in light or adjacent to another character — or not (alone in the shadows). This allows the investigator to know which characters are innocent. As the turns progress, the investigator tries to eliminate suspects while Jack tries to escape. Intuition, logic, and cold blood will be necessary for each of the two participants.
21763.name: Mr. Jack
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 27: Broom Service Review - Questions from a Hat
Episode 5 - Camp Abeartoir Part 7: The Final Beginning
Episode 7: Terra Mystica, Rambo: First Blood, and a Digital App Medley
The Dice Steeple # 17 - The Choices We Make & Why with Special GUests Burky & Badger
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 56!!!
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 61!! Don't Forget The Contest

21766.name: One Hundred & One Romantic Nights
21766.description:
One Hundred & One Romantic Nights: A Romantic Game for Lovers

This comes with two custom six-sided dice and an brief instruction brochure in a card-backed plastic bubble package. The two dice have sides that read:

1) Home Escape, Hugs & Kisses, Star Gazing, Talk, Show Time and Love Notes

2) Go for a Drive, Dinner, Picnic, Breakfast, Naughty but Nice and Go for a Walk.

One Hundred & One Romantic Nights is for every couple who believes that there can never be too much romance in their lives. With a simple roll of the dice it's easy to spice up nights & weekends. And with over one hundred combinations, this game guarantees a lifetime of unforgettable romantic nights.

Instructions:
Roll the dice secretly if you plan to surprise your lover, or roll the dice together and start play immediately! Use either one or both dice together and refer to the mini guide for pointers if necessary. Play everyday or once a week, but remember to play regularly. Time & place is always up to you.

Keep in Mind...
Have fun with each roll that you take. Give & take encouragement. Dare to go out on a limb and try something new. Do what you can afford & improvise when necessary. And above all else, enjoy yourself and your loved one at all times.

While the expression of romance has changed over the course of time, the underlying purpose has always remained the same. Romance is about escaping from the grind of everyday life to share a magical moment with the one you love.

Lover's Choice: The Essence of Romance, Carson City, NV

21768.name: More Urban Myth Volume #2
21768.description:
More Urban Myth Volume #2 is a card game follow up to the 2002 board game. There are 194 game cards divided into 6 categories.

The goal of the game is to be the first player to spell the word TRUE or MYTH by collecting the letters on the back of the game cards. You collect game cards by correctly guessing which cards contain true statements, and which ones are myths.

Each card has either a letter (M-Y-T-H-R-U-E) or is a wild card. Wilds can be used as any letter.

Players take turns drawing cards, announcing the category and then reading the statement printed on the card to the player to their left. That player then guesses TRUE or MYTH, if they are correct they get the card.

boardgamehonor: 2007 Charles S. Roberts Best Pre-World War II Boardgame Nominee
21769.description:
From MMP's site:

July, 1809. The uneasy alliance of Wellesley's Army of Portugal and Cuesta's Army of Extremadura was being pressed from every direction by the King of Spain, Joseph Bonaparte's, Army.

Forced to make a stand, a two day battle occurred which mauled both sides but allowed the Allies to escape towards Portugal.

Talavera is MMP's newest game in the Napoleonic Brigade Series (NBS) and features the end result of half a decade of brainstorming and intensive playtesting - the 3.0 NBS rules set. It is fast playing. It is furious. And, finally, it is about leading armies. MMP, Dean, and the Honchos think you will enjoy them very much.

BUT THATS NOT ALL!

Talavera also contains the mini-game on the small, but decisive, 1808 battle of Vimieiro.

Fought outside of Lisbon in August of 1808 between the British and French Armies of Portugal, French General Junot was defeated and surrendered both his army and Portugal to the British - setting the stage for the Peninsula War.

Napoleon Brigade Series (NBS)
- scale = 180-200 m/hex (197-219 yrd/hex);
- time = 30 min/GT (60 min/Night-GT);
- strength = 150 inf (100 cav)/SP
21769.name: Talavera

21770.name: El Retrato Espanol: Del Greco A Picasso
21770.description:
"A game which stimulates the mind."
Instructions: Shuffle the pieces face down and then form a square with them. Each player in turn turns over two pieces and the one who finds the most matching pictures is the winner.

What is interesting about this particular variation of picture matching is that the pictures are actually portraits found in the Museo Nacional Del Prado (Prado National Museum).

21771.name: Magic Cauldron Game
21771.description:
Players aim to be the first to fill their cauldron in this mathematically educational game for children Ages 4 - 8.

The ingredients cards each have a number on the reverse. When a player has his turn, he turns it over to reveal a number.

Sum cards are spread out on the table. The player drawing an ingredient card, has to find a sum (using =,-, x) that equals the number on the ingredient. They then rub the "magic black ghost" on the back of the sum card. If that number equals the one on their ingredient, then they get to add that card to their cauldron board.

You need 10 ingredients to fill your cauldron and win the game.

You can play an alternative version whereby the sum cards are turned over one at a time and the ingredient cards are spread out on the table.

21772.name: Goal!
21772.description:
There are 44 Soccer cards with attractive artwork depicting different English football club kits from the 1950s. Most cards have a number on them from 2-11, which corresponds to each position on the soccer pitch - for example, 9 is a center forward.

You have to place the cards you get to make attacks on your opponents goal. 3 cards are needed to make up a defensive or attacking formation. Goalkeeper cards and free kick cards can help to upset the balance of your opponent's plays.

The possible formations are set out on player aid cards - for instance:
4,2,3 or 5,2,3 make saving(defensive moves)

and 5,7,9 or 6,10,11 make attacking moves.

The game is played over two halves and the player with the most goals wins.

There are separate rules for play with 3 or 4 players.

All the English teams in the First Edition set were in the First or Second Divisions at the end of the 1958/59 season, and never after that (Grimsby and Barnsley being relegated from the Second Division in that year).

21773.name: Schillerstraße: Das Spiel
21773.description:
From Spiele-Offensive:

Convince your fellow players of the advantages of Italian men. Get a case of beer from somewhere, anywhere. Or get everyone together to practice a Canon. A total of 132 bizarre directorial instructions await the players.

When Uncle Fritz tries his hand at being a sports reporter or sister Lucy puts on her famous cucumber facial, everyone can't help but laugh. Using the director's instructions, each player must improvise a short scene that incorporates all of the directions.

21774.name: African Queen
21774.description:
A very rare and interesting abstract strategy game by Alex Randolph.
This game is part of the Abacus wood box series.

21775.name: Ishi
21775.description:
A Nim-like abstract game played in two parts. In the first part, players place stones on the board, and the player placing the last stone loses. In the second part, players proceed to remove the stones, and the player removing the last stone loses. In order to win the game it is necessary to win both parts.

A key feature of the game is that the number of stones you can place or remove depends on how many stones your opponent placed or removed on the previous turn.

The game was published by Ravensburger as part of their Präsent Series. Each item in this series contained two games; Ishi was paired with Go (the Ishi board is on the back of the Go board, and it uses Go stones as pieces).

21776.name: Jot
21776.description:
Jot is a Scrabble-like game, played on a "write-on, wipe-off" board with special pens. Rather than building words from a limited number of letters, each player first rolls a special die, which serves both to dictate the limits of his/her word, and as a one-minute timer. (The die itself is pressure-sensitive, and will start timing when rolled.)

Players must add letters or words to the existing word-pattern, as indicated by the die. (For example, a die roll of "+2" means they must add two letters to the board, with the result being a still-legitimate crossword configuration.)

A player can always, in lieu of rolling the die, select from a deck of cards that define a general type of thing (e.g. "birds," "sports," "words beginning with 'R'") The player must add a word that meets the criterion of the card.

Points are scored for number of letters in newly formed words, with standard Scrabble-like bonus spaces applying. First player to set number of points wins the game.

21777.name: Number Rings
21777.description:
In Ring-A-Round, each player chooses a color (red, blue, green, yellow) and has their own playing field of 18 round spaces. They also have colored rings (20) that are used to cover the round raised playing spaces.

On each player’s turn, they roll three six-sided dice and use addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division to form the numbers listed on their spaces. So, a roll of 2-6-6 could be used to form an 18 [ (2x6)+6=18 ]. You can also cover multiple spaces in one turn. For example, if you roll a 2-3-4, then you could cover the spaces for 2, 3, and 4. You can also cover the spaces in your opponents’ fields to slow them down.

The first person to cover all 18 spaces in their own playing field wins.

21778.description: A game about knitting sweaters for shorn sheep: a very simple pattern matching game for young children. Colorful, with lots of variations as the players get older.
21778.name: Bella Lanella

boardgamehonor: 2007 Charles S. Roberts Best Pre-World War II Boardgame Nominee
2007 Charles S. Roberts Best Pre-World War II Boardgame Winner
2007 Charles S. Roberts Best Wargame Graphics Nominee
2007 Charles S. Roberts Best Wargame Graphics Winner
21779.description:
(From the GMT website:)

Twilight in the East: The Eastern Front, 1914 models the battles that took place in Poland and Galicia during the first year of World War One. Beginning with the Russian invasions of Prussia and Galicia in August and ending after the Battle of Lodz in December, it recreates the ebb and flow of the huge forces sent marching across the Eastern Front in 1914.

The game features an innovative combat system which takes into account the magnitude of the forces involved in each individual combat and various factors such as amount and type of artillery present, flank attacks, and fieldworks, among other things. It also features a fluid Movement, Counter-Movement, Forced March movement system and Combat Effectiveness Level tracking system that requires formations to periodically rest and recuperate.

All the scenarios except the introductory scenario allow both sides to be simultaneously on the offensive and defensive on different parts of the battlefield. Additionally, armies that were on the offensive one game turn can quickly find themselves on the defensive a game turn later.

The game includes five scenarios: First Battle of the Masurian Lakes, Lublin, Battle for Galicia, Tannenberg Campaign and the Grand Campaign game.

The CSR Award winning support magazine 1914: Dispatches http://www.boardgamegeek.com/weblink/118300/1914-dispatches-... includes two new scenarios. The Battle for Ivangorod is a learning scenario. The Battles of Lodz and Krakau is a massive scenario that uses almost the entire counter mix.

GMT's C3i magazine #26 contains a CSR Award winning article and expansion scenario The Dragoni Variant (includes new counters).
21779.name: 1914: Twilight in the East

21780.name: On to Richmond American Civil War Miniature Rules

21781.description:
The Italian Set is an expansion for the base-game History of War. It uses the same game mechanics but introduces the Italian forces into HoW. As always there is a solid mixture of base improvements, territory improvements, units and action cards. The Italian expansion also introduces a new card type: the upgrade. These cards can be played on units and give them some unique abilities. The Italian Set may not be played stand-alone although it has starter-size too!

Expands

History of War
21781.name: History of War: Italian Expansion Set

21782.description:
The Russian Set is an expansion for the base-game History of War. It introduces the Russian forces to History of War. This expansion has base improvements, territory improvements, units, action cards and upgrades as well as other sets of HoW - but is not playable stand-alone. The mixture of the cards concentrates on the new Russian units and is only supplemented by the other card types.

Expands

History of War
21782.name: History of War: Russian Expansion Set

21783.description:
"Fall Gelb" is an expansion for the base-game History of War which introduces the French forces into the game. The expansion consists of two sets - one with the French forces and one with the German forces. The expansion may not be played stand-alone although there are included new base improvements, territory improvements, upgrades and action cards as well. But the mixture of the cards concentrates on the units of each side.

Expands

History of War
21783.name: History of War: "Fall Gelb" Edition

21784.name: Sound Bingo
21784.description:
Be the first to match all your pictures to the sounds!

An electric toy gives away a sound every time you press it. If you have the corresponding animal or thing on your playing board you close the door to it, and the first one to close all the doors wins.

boardgamecompilation: Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot Deluxe Limited Edition
21785.description:
The Killer Bunnies Perfectly Pink Booster Deck adds 55 cards to your existing set, a Highest Enlisted Rank Marker, a Pink Pawn, and a Pink twelve-sided die!

Expands:

Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot
21785.name: Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot Perfectly PINK Booster
boardgameexpansion: Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot

21786.name: Battle of Manila
21786.description:
A very early Parker Brothers game (often mentioned in histories of the company),
Battle of Manila is a Spanish American War boardgame with chromolithographed box lid and board with Manila Bay, 15.5" x 19.5" x 2" high.

Unlike today's heavily detailed "conflict simulations", this game apparently mainly involved hitting soldier targets on a board with hand held cannons firing wooden "bullets".

This game did help cement Parker Bros. reputation as a patriotic American company, helping sales and its image with the American public.

21787.description:
Rules in French only .
Book with very short historical events presentation (1 page) plus 6 pages of rules plus 1 page with orders of battle.
The turn represent 2 days.
Game includes a big fold-able mapboard representing the battlefield and die-cut counters.

From the advertisement insert/game list for Jeux Descarts found within the boxed game:

Dien Bien Phu, the final battle of the war in Indochina. The French forces are surrounded by the Viet-Minh army. The outcome of the battle will be deadly. This war game almost puts us in the actual conditions of the battle. Can you change the course of history and defeat the Viet-Minh? A well balanced game that is accessible to all war game fans, even amateurs.
21787.name: Diên Biên Phu

21788.name: Panicozoo
21788.description:
The animals escape from the Zoo and the players must find them as soon as possible!

15 Cards displaying 14 different animals each are placed on the table. One animal is missing. Players must locate the missing animal quickly.

Memory, observation and reflexes are required to win.

21789.description: Wargame based on the Battle of Deversoir in the Yom Kippur War, 1973. This game was inspired by the 1975 SPI's Chinese Farm and was published only in Brazil in the early 80's, along with SPI's Wurzburg and Strike force 1 (A Batalha das quatro horas), as part of a collection called "Todos os Jogos" (only these three were wargames, however). They came all together in a ziplock and no boxed versions were available.
21789.name: A Guerra do Yom Kippur

boardgamehonor: 2006 Deutscher Spiele Preis Best Family/Adult Game 2nd Place
2006 Golden Geek Best Family Board Game Nominee
2006 Golden Geek Best Gamer's Board Game Nominee
2006 International Gamers Awards - General Strategy; Multi-player Nominee
2006 Japan Boardgame Prize Best Advanced Game Winner
2006 Meeples' Choice Award
2006 Spiel der Spiele Hit mit Freunden Recommended
2006 Spiel des Jahres Nominee
2006 Spiel des Jahres Winner
2007 Golden Geek Best Family Board Game Nominee
2007 Hra roku Nominee
2007 Hra roku Winner
2007 Nederlandse Spellenprijs Nominee
2007 Vuoden Peli Adult Game of the Year Nominee
2007 Vuoden Peli Adult Game of the Year Winner
2008 Årets Spill Best Family Game Nominee
2008 JoTa Best 2-Player Board Game Nominee
2008 JoTa Best Light Board Game Nominee
2008 JoTa Best Light Board Game Winner
21790.description:
In Thurn & Taxis, players build post office routes across Bavaria and the regions around, collecting bonus points in various ways. The board shows a map of all the cities, with roads leading from each one to some of its neighbors. There are various colored regions around the board, most with two or three cities, and a large region with all the Bavarian cities in the center.

Players build postal routes from city to city to city so that each city is adjacent to the next city on the route and there is a road connecting these two cities. Each route must consist of at least three cities. Players may only build one route at a time. Routes are represented by melded city cards arranged in the order of the route.

Players start with a supply of 20 post offices in their color, a carriage house card and a player aid card. The board is populated with bonus tiles, carriage cards and city cards. On a turn a player will draw a card from a display of six, face up, city cards (or the top of the face down deck) and meld one card, either starting a new route or adding to the current one. If after adding to the route, the length of the route is at least three cities, the player may declare it finished and score it. The player may, depending on the length of the route and which cities are in the route, place post offices in the cities, collect bonus tiles, and acquire a higher value carriage. Optionally, the player may receive support from one postal official in the form of: drawing a second card, melding a second card, refreshing the six city card display, or acquiring a higher value carriage than the route length when finishing a route. Once a route is scored the city cards of that route are discarded, and the player begins a new route on his next turn.

When a player exhausts his supply of post offices or acquires a value 7 carriage the end of the game is triggered. Play continues until the player who is last in turn order finishes his turn, and the game ends. Players score points for their highest valued carriage and bonus tiles, and lose points for unplaced post offices. The player with the most points wins.

The fact that you *must* add at least one city to your route each turn or lose the whole route gives the game an enjoyable planning element.
boardgameversion: Albi Czech edition with SdJ and Hra roku
Rio Grande Second edition with SdJ
21790.name: Thurn and Taxis
boardgameexpansion: Thurn and Taxis: All Roads Lead to Rome
Thurn and Taxis: Power and Glory
Thurn und Taxis: Der Kurier der Fürstin
boardgamepodcastepisode: BGTG 64 - Oct 23, 2006 - SR & Feedback show (Thurn und Taxis, Gene Pool, Wallamoppi)
Durchgespielt – Spiel des Jahres 2006: Thurn und Taxis
The Spiel #68 - That's A Wrap - 2008 Holiday Gift Guide

21791.description:
In Masons, players represent architects, who together establish cities on the landscape of the game board. When a city is completed, all players score points for "guild cards" they play, with the right timing in playing the right card making all the difference.

Each turn, a player first establishes a new wall somewhere on the board. Each wall will be enclosed by two towers, and will have one house placed on each side of it. It's possible for a wall to need only one, or zero, new towers by putting it next to existing towers. It's possible for only one house to be placed, if the wall is placed along the outside of the game board.
After placing the wall, the player rolls three dice to determine the color of one of the towers (the color of a possible second tower may be freely chosen), and that of the two houses (if only one house is placed, then the player may choose which of the dice to pick for the color of the house).
Finally, if the newly placed wall causes a piece of land to be fully enclosed, a new city has been established. If the new city borders one or more existing cities, it may be combined with one of those cities. Two houses of the same color inside the city are upgraded to a palace. A scoring round is now triggered, during which all players get to play one or two "guild cards", and then draw one new card. Each guild card will score a feature of either the just completed city, or outside it. Possible features are the number of houses & palaces or towers of a specified color, the number of fields of the city, the number of houses inside a "district" on the board, the number of palaces inside a city, the different number of colors inside a city, or the total number of completed cities. At the end of a scoring round, whichever player is in last place may discard as many guild cards as desired, and draw new ones to replace them.

The game ends when all pieces of a certain type have been played, and the winner is whoever has the most points.
21791.name: Masons

21792.name: Wetten Dass ...?
21792.description:
Based on the famous TV-show. From Spiele-Offensive:

Excellent, the bet's good! Whether alone or in a team, with the actors, artists, or even "Wanna Bet...?" bet, each player / team has difficult tasks to complete in five different categories in order to reach the betting couch and win the game.

21793.name: Football Frenzy
21793.description:
Overview (from publisher's website):

Football Frenzy is an easy to play strategy football game. You don’t need to know how to play football to play! You get to call plays just like the real coaches based on what play you think the other player is going to call. You then reveal your choices and the game system tells you what happens.

The game even includes turn-overs, touchdowns, field goals, safeties, and more!

Key Points:

- Very easy to play.
- Good for ages 7 and up.
- Learn the basics of real football as you play.
- Plays so quickly, you can play while watching a game on TV.
- Each play takes 5 seconds to run.
- Games can be played in 30 minutes.

Component List:
- Built-in Tutorial and Help Windows in Vassal
- 40 Full Color cards
- Full color Football field

Target Audience:
This is a great game for football fans and people who know football fans.

Game Formats:
Virtual Tabletop (via vassal online system)
PDF Download

21794.description:
First Supplement for the Gothic Horror - Vampire Wars miniature rules set from West Wind Productions.

No new rules but provide stat's for 5 new vampire counts & 5 new slayers as well as henchmen, 2 immortals, and scenarios for all of the new figures.
21794.name: Vampire Wars: The Antagonists

21795.description:
An expansion in the Dungeon Twister series of games. As all expansion, it can be played as a stand-alone game (if you know the rules from the basic game, available on the game website and you have a set of card). You can also combine it with the basic game and other expansions in order to have a different set of team and room each time you play.

This particular expansion is focused on giving characters muscles. Most of them move slower than typical characters, but they are among the very strongest and most diverse characters in their combat abilities.

Expands

Dungeon Twister
21795.name: Dungeon Twister: Mercenaries

21796.name: Galactic Space Games
21796.description: 6 games in a big book (15.5" x 22.5" - closed). The games are rather simple. The book came with various bingo chips and dice in one corner.

21797.name: Merrycourt
21797.description: An acting and improv game in a Medieval court setting. Present and try up to 40 cases included in the box.

boardgamehonor: 2006 Lucca Games Best Family Game
2007 Golden Geek Best Party Board Game Nominee
21798.description:
This is an original party game for 4 to 14 players. Players are split into two "football teams" composed of a single "coach" and a number of "players".

Each "player" sits opposite a "player" from the opposing team, with all players of a team on one side of the table and their coach standing behind the rival team on the opposite side of the table so they clearly watch him.

The board is composed by a "football field" gridded board, 2 small dice, 3 normal dice and some "action cards" showing the position that each wooden "soccer player" will have to reach in the field.
In addition each team has 2 team-rose(?) cards and 8 full color wooden soccer figures with a number on the back and front.

The prototype I tried contained 3 teams: Japan, Greece and Eastern-Europe. The soccer player names are quite hard to say because the author deliberately invented really strange and long names.

To win you have to put the ball in the net more times than other team.

The game is noisy and hilarious. Each coach gets an action card. Each player get a "number" that represent the t-shirt number of the figures they will control (more than one there are less than 14 players).

Only the coach see the action card and have to call BY NAME (of soccer players not of the people playing the game) to indicate where to move to without talking, without indicating the wooden soccer players. The only way to communicate is to give him indications with his hands or miming something as real coach do.

Every time a wooden soccer player is in the right position the coach scream "PASS IT" and so on the other wooden soccer player until the last is positioned and the coach screams "SHOOOOOT!!!""

All the players stop play. If the team is positioned exactly as the action card requires, the last player who moved a wooden soccer player for the team throws a die to score a goal.

Some penalties are given to the coach for performing forbidden actions (like calling wooden soccer players by number or indicating it by pointing) and if the action card is not correctly reproduced.

RETHEMED : HysteriCoach Hockey
21798.name: HysteriCoach

21799.name: Space Pilot
21799.description:
The object of the game is to win the most money by getting to the planets Mercury through Saturn from Earth and claiming their mineral resources. Each player gets a space-o-meter to record the number of millions of miles they have traveled on each leg of the journey. Movement is governed by a spaceship spinner that advances from 10 to 90 million miles per turn. To claim a planet, you have to be the first to have your mileage hit the orbit range of a planet. For example, to claim Mercury, you have to hit the 100 to 130 million mile range. If you go over, you have to reverse your direction and start subtracting mileage for each spin.

Once all planets are claimed, you add up the value of your planets. These range from 10 billion dollars for Mercury's gold to 50 billion dollars for Saturn's plutonium. These are very generous sums for 1951!

This game has rich retro decco graphics. The artwork is very similar to the 2005 Zathura: Adventure is Waiting. In fact, the spaceships are nearly identical.

21800.name: Star Trek Game
21800.description:
The object of the game is to move your spaceship pawn from the Earth to three of six orbiting planets and be the first one to return to Earth. The game is played on a 36 by 36 grid with the Earth at the center. Players get fuel cards numbered 1 through 10 to control their movement. Each turn, you play one fuel card to move your ship that number of squares either horizontally or vertically, but not both.
There are also two fuel ships. Every player on his turn rolls a die and moves one of the fuel ships. If you land next to a fuel ship, you can retrieve any one used fuel card. When you are out of fuel, you can only move one square per turn. You also retrieve any 3 used fuel cards on every planet you land on.
Each planet has a series of 10 to 12 dots that describe its entry/exit orbit. To leave Earth, you have to follow the 12 orbit dots before you enter the vertical and horizontal grid of open space. Likewise, when you want to land on a planet, you have to start on the outermost orbit dot and follow the orbit down to the planet's surface. Sorry, no transporters in this game.

21801.name: Biker Mice from Mars: Rock... 'N Ride! Card Game
21801.description: In turn, players grab a card from the messy pile of cards and exchange it with one in their hand. Once a player has obtained 3 Biker Mice, 3 of their bikes, and 1 Lawrence Limburger Card, they win the round and move one space closer to Quigley Field. The first person to reach Quigley Field is the winner!

21803.name: Barnyard Boogie Woogie
21803.description: Hilarious game of pantomime will keep players dancing and singing for hours! Roll the colored die, travel around the barnyard game board collecting farm animals along the way. In order to claim an animal card you must imitate the animal. Oink like a pig, Moo like a cow, waddle like a duck, lots of action for young kids and parents too.

21804.description:
Traditional Card Games is not an individual game, but a game system including games that can be played with a traditional deck(s) of cards.

Not all card games can be mentioned in the database. There are many regional card games that aren't as widespread as games like Poker or Blackjack. This entry is for all card games that can be played with a standard deck of cards.

The standard deck playing card games page lists games already in the BoardGameGeek database. Or check out the list of games belonging to the Traditional Card Games family.

Other BGG Sources:

The Book of Cards for Kids
Oxford Dictionary of Card Games
Card Games Around the World
Bicycle Official Rules of Card Games
Penguin Encyclopedia of Card Games




See Also:

Miscellaneous Card Game Accessory
Miscellaneous Game Accessory




Related Resources:

Favorite Games with Standard Playing Cards
Pictorial Reviews of Custom Playing Cards
21804.name: Traditional Card Games

21805.name: BuddhaWheel
21805.description:
The idea is that players go around a board based on the Buddhist wheel of life. A dice decides which realm he or she is born into and they then move around the section.

A "karma card" decides which realm the player is to be reborn into. The idea is to escape from the wheel and become a Buddha - once you've done that you can opt to go back in to help other players and prolong the game into infinity.

21806.description:
Alternative names:
Plume, sais-tu pecher?
Piuma dimmi sai pescare?

"Little Polar Bear, do you know fishing?" is a memory-like game. Players move little polar bear around a circular track over ice flows. On the back of the flows there are printed fish in 4 different colors. In the middle of the board, there are 16 wooden fish (4 of each color) placed face down. The player has to draw a fish that matches that printed on the floe. Players may decide whether they want to move one, two or three spaces, so memorizing the fish printed on the floes is as important as memorizing those in the center of the board.
21806.name: Kleiner Eisbär, kannst du fischen?

21807.name: Papa Bear
21807.description: Papa Bear's little son is continually changing his clothes, but wants to know each time exactly what he will end up looking like. Step-by-step, Papa Bear teaches his son about predicting outcomes in this fast-paced visual perception game for 2 to 5 players, Ages 5 and up

21808.description:
Hyborian Risk is an unofficial Risk variant, themed to Robert E. Howard's Hyborian Age world of Conan the Cimmerian. It was designed by Lewis Pulsipher, and published as an article in the Space Gamer number 37 (March, 1981), pages 16-17.

In addition to the map, Hyborian Risk includes variant rules for initial placement, stacking, reinforcements, and leaders (including Conan and the wizard Thoth-Amon).

Expands

Risk
21808.name: Hyborian Risk

21809.description:
APPLES TO APPLES®: BIBLE EDITION is the wild, party game that provides instant fun! for everyone! It’s as easy as "comparing apples to apples"... just open the box, deal the cards, and you’re ready to play! Select the card from your hand that you think is best described by a card played by the judge. If the judge picks your card, you win that round. And everyone gets a chance to be the judge!

Each round is filled with surprising and outrageous comparisons from a wide range of people, places, things and events from our Christian history. Fast moving and refreshing, Apples to Apples is perfect for any get together with family and friends!

Part of the Apples to Apples Series.
21809.name: Apples to Apples: Bible Edition

21810.name: Radio Collector: Frontier Gentleman Series Log
21810.description:
This eBook contains information on the popular adult western, Frontier Gentleman, starring John Dehner. The log contains air dates and episode titles, along with brief plot descriptions. Also included is a list of cast members and writers, where known.

Besides the log, you will also receive a CD label in .jpg format that you can import into your favorite label printing program. And a set of 6 collector cards that can be used to play with the Radio Collector Card Game, or just printed out and collect them for the fun filled facts listed on each card.

21811.name: Mike Mulligan and His Steam Shovel Dig It! Action Game
21811.description:
From the publisher:
Join Mike Mulligan and his steam shovel, Mary Anne, in their race to dig a cellar in just one day. Use your steam shovel flippers to fling pieces of dirt into the back of the Popperville Trucking Company truck. Each time your dirt hits its mark, another Popperville towns person joins your crowd to watch you dig. The first player to collect a crowd of 5 Popperville people wins!

21812.name: Radio Collector: Fort Laramie Series Log
21812.description:
This eBook contains information on the popular adult western, Fort Laramie, starring Raymond Burr. The log contains air dates and episode titles, along with brief plot descriptions. Also included is a list of cast members and writers, where known.

Besides the log, you will also receive a CD label in .jpg format that you can import into your favorite label printing program. And a set of 6 collector cards that can be used to play with the Radio Collector Card Game, or just printed out and collect them for the fun filled facts listed on each card.

21813.name: Das Gurkensolo
21813.description:
The game features a race of four wooden cucumbers along 12 numbered fields. Each player draws a card showing the order in which the cucumbers should pass the finishing line.
In every turn each player picks two cards containing statements about the race's standings, e.g. "The red cucumber is not ahead of the green cucumber." Now the player must choose one cucumber to move forward by one field or two, if he succeeds in making one of the two statements true and the other one false after his or her move.
The player whose order of cucumbers matches the race's outcome best wins the game.

21816.name: Mini Pro Golf
21816.description:
Players Tee-off from the 9 different Tee boxes and proceed down the fairways to the green.

Using the flag to mark the preferred hole on the green each player uses his driver/iron combo club to maximize vertical projection and distance finishing with his/her putter for sinking the final putt.

You can hook or slice the ball by changing the alignment of the club head for truly realistic shots just like you do on real golf courses.

Try to avoid coarse hazards such as water, trees and sand traps as you proceed down the 9 different fairways.

Keep track of up to four player scores at a time using the mini Pro Golf Score Card.

boardgamecompilation: Die Siedler von Catan: Das Kartenspiel – 10th Anniversary Special Edition Tin Box
21817.description:
The 7th expansion for The Settlers of Catan Cardgame. Künstler & Wohltäter (Artists & Benefactors) was released at Nürnberg 2006. Mayfair Games plans to release an English version on June 24, 2009.

Belongs to the Catan Series.
21817.name: Catan Card Game: Artisans & Benefactors
boardgamefamily: Die Siedler von Catan: Das Kartenspiel / Catan Card Game

21818.name: The Doctor Lucky Ambivalence Pack
21818.description:
An expansion for both Kill Doctor Lucky and Save Doctor Lucky.

Inside the usual envelope is a rule sheet and a double-sided eight-part map. One side of the map is the non-sinking S.S. Afgang for Kill Doctor Lucky, the other is the burning Hotel DuBois for Save Doctor Lucky.

Also included are rules for closing and opening doors that can be applied to any game in the KDL/SDL series.

UPDATE: As of 8/10/2013, this is now a free download from Cheapass Games' "BOULEVARD OF BROKEN GAMES".

21819.description:
Semi-generic starship combat game played using counters or miniatures. Rules are simple and include a ship construction system. Ready-made ship designs and scenarios are included.

Expanded by:

Voidstriker Ship Recognition Guide #1
21819.name: Voidstriker

21820.name: Big Damn Armies
21820.description: Part of the "Big Damn" line from Crunchy Frog, Big Damn Armies is a fantasy battle game. The rules are very simple, presented on single-sided photocopied sheets. Card stock miniatures with unit stats printed on them are included.

21821.name: Big Damn Space Battles
21821.description: A game in the "Big Damn" series from Crunchy Frog, this one is a very simple space combat game. Includes counters and a hex map.

21822.name: Splatter: The food fight game
21822.description:
The game comes with 48 cards and a set of instructions. The players need six-sided dice and to provide a set of 10 tokens for each player.

Turn Sequence:
1. Discard one cover card
2. Draw one card
3. Perform one action
a. Clean up
b. Attack
c. Draw one card
4. End of Turn

"Clean up": Any number of cards can be discarded to remove 2 "mess points" each.

"Attack": Up to 3 cards can be played for an attack, but no more than 1 "food", 1 "bonus", or 1 "aim" card. The defender may play up to three cards face-down as "cover". If the defender is missed, he or she may make a "smack back attack" which cannot be defended or retaliated against. The game ends when one player accumulates 10 or more "mess points". The game comes with a few very minor alternate rules.

21823.name: Bild im Bild
21823.description:
Bild im Bild is a memory game with an art theme.

Players compete to find the most pairs of tiles, matching details to their paintings. The tricky part- the detail tiles and painting tiles are the same size.

21824.name: Dodeccamente
21824.description: Dodeccamente from my cursory read of the rules appears to be a Backgammon variant set upon a circle. It allows for up to 6 players to play and uses 3 dice instead of two, which dramatically increases the complexity. You still split how the dice move pieces just as in Backgammon (although with a few additional constraints), and you send pieces back to "start" just as you do in Backgammon.

21825.name: Sketchword
21825.description: Think Fast! The clock is ticking! First make a word using the letters in your hand and on the Sketchword board. Then... sketch it! If someone guesses your word before time runs out, you score and so does the player who guessed. But each turn is a gamble in this game... do you go for a short, easy word for low points? Or do you take a chance on your drawing skills and try a harder word with a bigger reward? Sketchword is the best word game and the best drawing game combined into one box!

21826.name: World Wise European Edition
21826.description:
(Back of box):PUT THE WORLD IN YOUR HANDS with this great new educational family card game! No matter what your age or education level, no matter how little or how much you know about geography, you can be equally competitive. Parents and children can play and learn together. Prepare for an upcoming vacation or sharpen your knowledge for a business trip. Or just relax and have fun.

There is a card for each country on the European continent and each body of water bounding Europe, as well as wild cards and super wild cards. Each player must play a card whose geographic location shares a boundary with the card that was last played. Bluffing and using wild cards add strategy to the play.

Exciting and educational for 2-8 players, Ages 9 - 99

boardgamehonor: 2002 Spiel des Jahres Kinderspiel Recommended
21827.description: Where is the pelican about to fish? To guess where, the players put down one of their location tiles. Then the pelican is placed. Whoever has guessed right, gets the fish lying on the corresponding place. The pelican only gets the prey if nobody has guessed correctly. Who, with their shrewed guesses, will collect the most fish? For 2-4 players Ages 4 and up. Includes variant for elder players.
21827.name: Schnapp zu!

21828.description:
From the publisher:
Fields of Honor:World War II is a fast-paced wargame from Pinnacle. This new edition brings the battlefields of Europe to your tabletop and puts you in command of a company or more of US or German troops. The rules are easy to learn and quick to play, and provide a wealth of tactical options.

Included in this book are basic and advanced rules, the tokens and counters needed to play, Battle and Command Cards that introduce the uncertainty and surprises of the battlefield, and army lists for US and German forces of World War II, covering all major troop types and weaponry.

The Fields of Honor includes the rules, War in the West campaign, Terrain Pack 1, containing the scenery needed to fight your tabletop battles, and Battleset 1, which features every major troop type and support asset for the US and German forces on the Western Front.

With this, the ultimate Fields of Honor bundle, you can fight for control of Europe, from the bloody beaches of Omaha on D-Day, to the last throw of dice in the Bulge, and on to Remagen, with countless stops along the way.
21828.name: Fields of Honor: World War II

21829.description: Each player has a group of forest robbers from Sherwood. In each round players simultaneously attack three travelers with a hidden count of robbers. According to the robbers, properties for each traveler is determined by which group attacked him. Successful groups take some reward. Victory points are earned from a range of one's own villages. Some rewards allow the player gain a village and score points from them.
21829.name: Sherwood

21830.name: Zizanie beach
21830.description:
This game comes with Jeux & Stratégie magazine n.17 (January/February 2006)

In what is ultimately an abstract game, two players, each representing a male, compete on an evolving archipelago (which they build in the beginning of the game) and aim to end up isolated with the only girl on the set of islands.

On his turn, the player must first move his own pawn or move the girlfriend, and then move an island to another place in the archipelago.

21832.name: Sator
21832.description:
Sator the first game from a pentalogy of abstract games based in the Latin magic square.





S

A

T

O

R



A

R

E

P

O



T

E

N

E

T



O

P

E

R

A



R

O

T

A

S




The game can be downloaded from the author web page in catalan and french:

http://www.comascoma.com

21833.description:
KOALA BROTHERS - LET'S GO HOME is a childrens memory game based on the animated children's television series.

What a mess! The vehicles belonging to the Koala Brothers and their friends are completely mixed up and little by little, as night falls, the way home is hard to find. Where is the scooter? Who knows where Frank and Buster’s house is? Your mission is to help the friends to get themselves and their vehicles back to the right house.

The game is comprised of five small boards representing the homes of the Koala Brothers and their friends. Each house has three spaces on it. The (two) Koala brothers and four of their friends appear on six red counters and their preferred means of transport are represented on five blue counters (the koala brothers fly a twin seater plane).

At the start of the game the counters are mixed up, one of the red ones removed, and the remaining ten distributed at random between the houses.

Players take it in turns to roll a special die and take actions accordingly:

• If it shows a number then the player moves a piece of his choice the number of free spaces indicated on the die. Movement can be in either a clockwise or anticlockwise direction.
• If it shows an eye the player can secretly look at a counter of his/her choice.
• If it shows an arrow the player selects a playing piece of his/her choice and turns it up so that everyone can see.

Players may also gamble tokens by secretly peeking at counters. If the counter is at the right house then it wins tokens, if not it loses tokens.

Play proceeds until all the friends and their vehicles are face up in the right location. The player with the greatest number of tokens is the winner.
21833.name: Die Koala Brüder: Auf Geht's Nach Haus!

21834.name: Walk the Plank
21834.description:
The object of the game is to collect 4 pieces of treasure from the Treasure Chest.

To this end, players have to move their ship from a dockside towards the island where the treasure is. They do this by rolling up to 4 colored dice. Each player rolls as many dice as there are players each time it's his/her go. Each player moves their ship according to the number on the die corresponding to their ship. If a player lands on a place next to a plank, the other players must shout out "Walk the Plank" before the dice are thrown again. If they succeed in this, the player concerned must go back to the start.

boardgamehonor: 2007 Kinderspielexperten "8-to-13-year-olds" Nominee
21835.description:
The Mystery of Mont Saint Michel

(the following text is translated from www.schmidt.de)

Have you heard? Secret messages are circulating on the famous monastery mountain. But which ones are true, and which ones are false? It's not surprising that mistrust accompanies the secret meeting. You need intuition and deduction to solve the mystery. But things could be so simple - the messages can be found in the playing pieces.

This is a Nuremberg 2007 release.

Ages 8 and up.
21835.name: Mont Saint Michel
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 12 – Drei Magier Spiele – Neuheiten Frühjahr 2007

21836.name: Scrambled Heads!
21836.description:
SCRAMBLED HEADS! - The Crazy Clues Game! is a similar game to HEADBANZ and others of that ilk.

Players take it in turns to be the 'Head Case' by placing a headpiece on their head. A card is placed in the headpiece by another player such that it can be seen by all the players except the one actually wearing the headpiece.

The game card shows three subjects in three different categories - Food and Drink, Entertainment and Miscellaneous. The subject is something that should be familiar to all the players and could be anything from a famous film star to a wild animal.

The 'Head Case' selects whether he wishes clues on the category on the top, middle or bottom row of his card, and is then informed of which particular category the subject belongs to.

The other players then take it in turns to offer clues as to what the subject is. Clues should be relevant to the subject but somewhat distant and slightly cryptic. Clues should not be derived from part of the subject title. The 'Head Case' has 10 seconds to try and guess the text on the card at which point the next player gives another clue.

Tokens are added into a central pile to indicate how many clues have been given - these tokens having been evenly distributed amongst the players at the start of the game. If the 'Head Case' guesses the subject then the player that gave the last clue must collect all the tokens. A player also gains them if he is unable to provide a suitable clue. In the event of the 'Head Case' not guessing the answer within 12 clues he fails and collects all the tokens from the pile,

Another player is then selected as the 'Head Case' and the while process is repeated. Play continues until one of the players runs out of tokens or when all players agree to stop.

21837.name: Word Master
21837.description:
Word Master is the perfect crossword-style game for having fun with words. It can be played anywhere, and with any number of people. The box includes all game components, plus a book with easy-to-follow rules and quick-reference anagram lists. Includes: 5 lettered dice, 200 magnetic letter tiles, game board and book of rules.

The game is won by having the highest score. Each word scores 1 point + 1 point per letter + any bonuses.

21838.name: Tug Boat
21838.description:
Move your barge around the board from port to port by pushing it with the Tug, but make sure not to hit any buoys and sound the alarms.
Play passes from one player to another whenever a buoy is hit and the alarm sounds, or when the marble reaches the end of the ramp. The first player to get all four of their loads to their final ports wins.

21839.description:
The game contains an 8×11 board and two armies (Yellow & Blue). Each army consists of 16 pieces (4 of each kind) with different abilities for each group.

The players deploy their armies (chess like) and try to capture 2 objective points on the enemy side.

There is a 4-player version of the game called: Cirkle 4
21839.name: Cirkle 2

21840.name: Cranium Hullabaloo DVD Game
21840.description:
From the publisher:
Just pop in the DVD, and the Hullabaloo host will guide you through your adventure, from setting up the 16 animal play pads to standing on a purple Cranium pad to start. You'll fly like an eagle to a triangle, stomp like a gorilla to a red pad, and swim to an animal that lives in the ocean!

Play along with the Hullabaloo Kids on-screen as you follow the host's instructions. When you hear, "Freeze!" everyone stays still and waits for the lucky pad to be announced. Everyone touching the lucky pad is a winner, and every game ends with a different celebration -- winners might take a bow, dance, do a victory jump, or … who knows? Part of the fun is finding out!

21841.name: Peak Experience: The Climbing Game
21841.description:
A multiple choice trivia game based on the broad range of challenges and experiences faced by real climbers - from airport bureaucracy to the final descent.

Anyone can play Peak Experience - you don't have to be an expert climber. If you enjoy adventure and the outdoors you'll love Peak Experience. Come climbing on awesome K2. Travel through exotic Pakistan on the trek towards base camp. Use your knowledge, common sense and judgment to make it to the summit and back to base camp. As in real climbing, success takes both skill and luck. So whether you are a veteran climber or an armchair adventurer, reach for the peak!

21842.name: Mentalogy
21842.description:
Mentalogy is a game which requires the player to remember and then recall a series of different words, numbers and pictures.

The winner is the first player to reach the finish point by remembering all the cards on the green, yellow, red and blue triangles in any order!

21843.name: Suffolk Downs
21843.description: A horse racing game from The Corey Game Company about Boston's own race track, Suffolk Downs.

21844.description:
From back of box:

Don't just sit there...Play!!

Draw a card. Did you get an Astronaut? A Ballerina? WOW! An ALLIGATOR!
GET UP & GO! Be an over-active alligator for 20 seconds! Put up your arms to make pretend alligator jaws. Open up wide and jump in the swamp for a quick swim. Wiggle and Wag! Stomp and Chomp! You were a great alligator! Other players will award you points for your perfect performance!

Contents:
55 Game Cards
24 Scoring Tiles
Sand Timer
Game Rules
21844.name: Get Up and Go

21845.description:
Crossings is an abstract strategy game for two players published in Sid Sackson's A Gamut of Games and Stephen Addison's 100 Other Games to Play on a Chessboard

It can be played with a standard set of Checkers.

The object of the game is to reach the opposite side of the board, while preventing the opponent from doing the same.

Reimplemented-by:
Epaminondas on a 14x12 board
21845.name: Crossings

21846.name: The Neighbours Game
21846.description:
From the box:- All your favorite neighbors characters will come alive when you create your own Neighbors story as you move around the board. If you know and love Neighbors, you won't be able to resist this game. If not, its still a wacky soap opera game all the family can enjoy.
The aim is to write an episode of Neighbors in three scenes. Player with the most points at the end wins.

21847.name: Gridrunner
21847.description: (from the manual) Gridrunner is a strategy game from two to four players. The object of the game is to move your pieces over the board and capture the pieces of the other players. The player with the most pieces at the end of the game wins. Playing time is two to three hours.

21848.name: Monopoly: Maailman Ihmeet
21848.description: In this version of Monopoly players are travelling around the world and there are different wonders of the world instead of properties.

21849.name: UNO H2O Splash
21849.description:
This version of UNO includes transparent, waterproof cards similar to UNO H2O and a special Whirlpool device. The Whirlpool has random effects that appear when shook (it works like a Magic 8-Ball).

The rules are simplified. For example, the winner conditions are no longer points based. The first player to win three hands wins the game. Also gone are rules regarding playing Wild Draw 4 Cards when you can play another card.

The Whirlpool is activated by playing a special Splash card or playing a 0 or a 2. The next player must then shake the Whirlpool and follow the results:
1) Draw H2O - draw until they get a blue, 2, 0 or wild card.
2) Wave Right - show a card to the player on the right.
3) Wave Left - show a card to the player on the left.
4) Wipeout - reverse order of play (player who started the Splash must use the whirlpool)

Other possible Whirlpool results are draw, discard and give cards.

The cards and Whirlpool are contained in a sturdy plastic box, with a slide on/off lid.

21850.description:
This accessories kit is to be used with the Milton Bradley Axis & Allies game. The accessories consist of operating rules for the new pieces only (included). 275 color coordinated plastic pieces, scaled to size, consisting of, heavy fighters, jeeps, jet fighters, land mines, landing craft, super bombers, and V2 rockets.

Expands:

Axis & Allies
